input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: InfobloxNIOS.

Find Fixed Address in Infoblox Grid Manager.
Note: IPv4 or IPv6 fixed addresses, and not both, can be retrieved in one request
Sample items Xml:
1> For IPV4 : <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>10.0.0.0</network> <mask>24</mask> <network-view>default</network-view> <network-type>ipv4</network-type> <ip-address>10.0.0.1</ip-address> <mac-address>00:00:00:11:11:11</mac-address> <dhcp-client-identifier>Value of dhcp-client-identifier</dhcp-client-identifier> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Building</key> <value>sample</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>
The Search criteria that can be followed are as below.
-> network,mask will get all the fixed address in the network. <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>10.0.0.0</network> <mask>24</mask> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> network,mask and network-view. <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>10.0.0.0</network> <mask>24</mask> <network-view>default</network-view> <network-type>ipv4</network-type> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> ip-address <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network-type>ipv4</network-type> <ip-address>10.0.0.1</ip-address> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> mac-address <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <mac-address>00:00:00:11:11:11</mac-address> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> dhcp-client-identifier <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <dhcp-client-identifier>Value of dhcp-client-identifier</dhcp-client-identifier> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> extensible-attributes <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Building</key> <value>sample</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2> For IPV6 <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>2002::</network> <mask>64</mask> <network-view>default</network-view> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> <ip-address>2002::6</ip-address> <duid>55:55</duid> <comment>Value Of Comment</comment> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Building</key> <value>sample</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>
The Search criteria that can be followed are as below.
-> network,mask will get all the fixed address in the network. <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>2002::</network> <mask>64</mask> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> network,mask and network-view. <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network>2002::</network> <mask>64</mask> <network-view>default</network-view> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> ip-address <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> <ip-address>2002::6</ip-address> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> duid <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> <duid>55:55</duid> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> comment <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> <comment>Value Of Comment</comment> </parameters> </item> </items>
-> extensible-attributes <items> <item> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> </target> <parameters> <network-type>ipv6</network-type> <extensible-attributes> <attribute> <key>Building</key> <value>sample</value> </attribute> </extensible-attributes> </parameters> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
target[Conditional]: host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to connect Infoblox Grid Manager. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64 Default value: Plain
timeout-secs[Optional] Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the attempt to connect to the Infoblox Grid Manager fails. Default value in seconds: 60
Note: If no adapter configurations are specified while configuring the adapter dynamic target need to be defined under "target" tag.
Note: Multiple parameters should not combined to define the search criteria, except for network,mask and network-view. The Search criteria that can be followed are as below. 1> IPV4 -> network,mask will get all the fixed address in the network. -> network,mask and network-view. -> ip-address -> mac-address -> dhcp-client-identifier -> extensible-attributes 2> IPV6 -> network,mask will get all the fixed address in the network. -> network,mask and network-view. -> ip-address -> duid -> comment -> extensible-attributes
network[Conditional] Specify the network.
mask[Conditional] Specify the mask for the network. Must be used with network parameter.
network-view[Conditional] Specify the network view in which the network is located.
network-type[Conditional] Specify the type of network, to know in which network type(ipv4/ipv6 search need to be performed). Valid values ipv6, ipv4 [default].
comment[Conditional] Specify the user comment for the Fixed Address.
ip-address[Conditional] ip-address tag contain the value for the ip-address of the fixed address that need to be searched.
mac-address[Conditional] MAC address of the fixed address. Used when IPV4 address searched using mac address.
dhcp-client-identifier[Conditional] dhcp-client-identifier, used in case of IPV4 fixed address search.
extensible-attributes[Conditional] Specify the extensible attributes for the network. E.g. Building, site etc.
duid[Conditional] DUID of the IPV6 fixed address.

documentation.description: Finds Network(s) in InfoBlog Grid Manager.
